meanings.definition: A small bracket or corbel used in classical architecture to support a cornice.
meanings.sent1: The modillion added an elegant touch to the cornice of the building.
meanings.sent2: The architect carefully placed each modillion to ensure the cornice's stability.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel thought the modillion was a tiny bed for napping.
meanings.sent4: The modillion stood out against the sky, like a miniature guardian of the cornice.
meanings.sent5: I will always remember the modillion as the small but crucial piece of the cornice puzzle.

meanings.definition: A decorative element resembling a small bracket used in furniture design.
meanings.sent1: The modillion on the cabinet added a touch of sophistication to the furniture.
meanings.sent2: She admired the intricate design of the modillion on the antique dresser.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten mistook the modillion for a tiny toy to bat around.
meanings.sent4: The modillion seemed to dance along the edge of the table, bringing life to the furniture.
meanings.sent5: The modillion's intricate patterns made it a standout feature of the furniture piece.
